intro: Cyathostemma micranthum, commonly known as the small-flowered cyathostemma, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and related species. The plant is characterized by its compact, shrub-like growth habit and produces clusters of small, tubular flowers. Its leaves are typically opposite and have a waxy texture, while its flowers are often pale green or yellowish in color. Cyathostemma micranthum is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
